title: Riot do you really read the boards...I mean, everyone seems to hate the game now
body:
Tons of posts from people who've played for years saying the game is simply unfun now. 

What do you think of that?  Are you just banking on new players and to hell with the people who build up the game (die hard players)?

I think you guys have lost perspective on what is the game should be doing.  As you add complexity, balancing becomes exponentially hard. I understand that game changing a little bit here and there, small tweaks from time to time. However, it seems like champions and items are always undergoing large changes.

Its not fun when everything shifts too much too fast.  Then we have to deal witn new brokenness, and wait for you to roll it back OR just make EVERYTHING else stronger.

I firmly believe your company lacks leadership in the sense that, balancing is just part of the process of making money. Its and end in of itself. The point of balancing seem to be simply to change things. 

You are driving away dedicated players, and trading them in for players who, at best, will be here for a few months or year, until newest flashy latest and greatest thing comes out. 

Good luck with that.

replies.body: The boards always look like they hate the game, it's just where people come to complain. Also if we learned anything from the "community patch notes" it's that Riot should never listen to the boards when considering game balance.
